Title: Authorizes a court to enter a prefiling order that prohibits a vexatious litigant from filing any new litigation propria persona without first obtaining permission to do so
Summary: Authorizes a court, on its own motion or the motion of a party, to enter a prefiling order that prohibits a vexatious litigant from filing any new litigation propria persona without first obtaining permission to do so from the presiding judge or justice of the court where the filing is proposed.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the civil practice law and rules, in relation to authorizing a court, on its own motion or the motion of a party, to enter a prefiling order that prohibits a vexatious litigant from filing any new litigation propria persona without first obtaining permission to do so from the presiding judge or justice of the court where the filing is proposed
